q: 1. If he _____ earlier, he wouldn't have missed the train.
expl: had left – past perfect is required in third conditional.

q: 2. I wish I _____ how to solve this problem.
expl: knew – past tense expresses a present unreal situation.

q: 3. Hardly _____ the bell rung when the students rushed out.
expl: had – after 'hardly', use past perfect.

q: 4. The man _____ wallet was stolen reported the theft.
expl: whose – possessive relative pronoun.

q: 5. I prefer tea _____ coffee.
expl: to – 'prefer A to B' is standard.

q: 6. Neither the teacher nor the students _____ ready.
expl: are – verb agrees with the nearest subject.

q: 7. He talks as if he _____ everything.
expl: knew – 'as if' for unreal present uses past tense.

q: 8. She suggested that he _____ to the doctor.
expl: go – subjunctive after 'suggest'.

q: 9. Not only _____ late, but he also forgot his book.
expl: did he arrive – inversion after 'not only' at the start.

q: 10. The book, together with the notes, _____ missing.
expl: is – 'together with' doesn't change subject number.

q: 11. Scarcely _____ the train left when it began to rain.
expl: had – past perfect after 'scarcely'.

q: 12. It's high time you _____ to bed.
expl: went – past tense shows urgency.

q: 13. By the time she arrives, we _____ our work.
expl: will have finished – future perfect for something completed before another future event.

q: 14. Each of the boys _____ given a present.
expl: was – 'each' takes singular verb.

q: 15. Had I seen him, I _____ hello.
expl: would have said – past unreal condition.

q: 16. He denied _____ the window.
expl: breaking – 'deny' is followed by gerund.

q: 17. She is one of the students who _____ always late.
expl: are – 'who' refers to 'students' (plural).

q: 18. This is the best movie I _____.
expl: have ever seen – present perfect with superlative.

q: 19. I look forward to _____ from you soon.
expl: hearing – 'to' is a preposition, followed by gerund.

q: 20. No sooner had he left _____ it started to rain.
expl: than – 'No sooner... than' is the correct structure.
